title: Nemetsky Peninsula
text:
Nemetsky Peninsula () is a peninsula in the far north region of continental <a href="European%20Russia">European Russia</a>. Its name is translated as "German peninsula". The peninsula is connected to the continent by a thin <a href="isthmus">isthmus</a>; thus, the peninsula is nearly completely surrounded by water. Administratively, it is included into the <a href="Pechenga%20raion">Pechenga raion</a> of <a href="Murmansk%20Oblast">Murmansk Oblast</a> and is within several hours of ride from <a href="Murmansk">Murmansk</a>.
History.
After the <a href="Russian%20Revolution%20of%201917">Russian Revolution</a>, the Nemetsky Peninsula () was ceded to <a href="Finland">Finland</a>. The peninsula was passed to the Soviet Union after the <a href="Second%20World%20War">Second World War</a> in 1945.
